alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 12:00AM CDT until March 25 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY... At 1200 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Petersburg, or 8 miles north of Fayetteville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Mulberry, Chestnut Ridge, Howell, Belleville, Harms, Mimosa and Booneville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
